title: [SOLVED]820-3332 Safe Mode
message:
Liquid damage - other shop tried to fix it.

It boots in most cases to Safe Mode.
I thought keyboard is damaged, but with new keyboard still same issue.

ALT key wont works during boot as well so it looks like SHIFT is pressed all the time.

Booted without keyboard and still same issue.
The only idea what I got is something wrong with Pin 3 on J5713 with line WS_LEFT_SHIFT_KBD but got no clue how to start.

J5713/3
Diode mode 0.415V

U5701 and U5750 looks clean and got 0.430V in diode mode on U5701/55 and U5750/9

When it boots then left shift wont works with old and new keyboard (left shift works OK on USB keyboard)

Any ideas?

title: [SOLVED]820-3332 Safe Mode
message: Sounds like the USB "hub" is functioning since external keyboards work. Inspect the keyboard connector.

title: [SOLVED]820-3332 Safe Mode
message: unplug trackpad, then try pram reset with new keyboard

title: [SOLVED]820-3332 Safe Mode
message:
No trackpad has nothing to do with this nor a PRAM reset.

Voltages on pin 1,2,3,4 of keyboard connector? Could be corrosion in the connector between pins 3 and 4 pulling shift key high. Could also be crap under or dead U5750.

title: [SOLVED]820-3332 Safe Mode
message: SOLVED - resoldered pin 3 on J5713 and works fine. Thank you guys
